number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you have a friend you really like playing with online, I really cant say anything else than WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? This game is wonderful, the combat is beautiful, the music is awesome, and the humour put into it actually wants you to read the text and kinda follow the plot, I was really sceptic to this game when we started and then you start to get the feel of the game.We ended up finishing the story mode that's currently out as it is early access still, and we've sat for about 8 hours if not more. The combat is very satisfying, especially with controller, I havent tried with mouse and keyboard, but with controller everything is smooth and awesome. The bossbattles are extremely wild and incredibly satisfying when you win, the battles are quite hard on normal difficulity, and when you die you dont really feel cheated or that anything is unfair, you just kinda laugh and get back at it. The graphics are a perfect 10/10 for the type of game it wants to be. beautiful particle effects, and animations. Some of the characters you meet are quite memorable, because of their attitude, or just humour. If you want something to play by yourself or with up to 4 friends , thats smooth, fun, challanging, and awesome, then this is the perfect game, and its not that expensive. I really reccommend this game even tho on the screenshots and video it might not look that extraordinary, but trust me, its fantastic. 9.5/10 from me.

								Possibly one of my favorite games ever. Sunk in almost 20 hours as of writing this.ᴮᵉᵉᶰ ᶰᵉᵍᶫᵉᶜᵗᶦᶰᵍ ᵒᵛᵉʳʷᵃᵗᶜʰ ᶠᵒʳ ᵗʰᶦˢSecrets of Grindea has kept my attention from the start. But oddly enough I enjoy the grind, you feel satisfaction when you finally acquire the item you've been busting your♥♥♥♥♥♥trying to obtain.To sum up my feelings about this game. It has AMAZING potential, and I hope to be along for the entire ride as the game develops. content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a fun, classic-feeling ARPG that's just as enjoyable solo as with friends, although I prefer multiplayer.  Difficulty ramps up with friends (up to 4). The game will provide 6-8 hours (curerntly as of this review) of base "Story Mode" content.  The temples ("dungeons") are very well thought-out and provide adequate challenge and they also display innovative mechanics. I played through story mode with 3 players in about 7 hours, and I wish there was more or more replayabilty in story mode. "Arcade Mode" is a bit slow to get into, especially with friends. The replayability is there, but it's kind of a slog to get started (and re-started). I bought the 4 pack from their website; would I spend $15/per player again on this game? Probably not. It's unfortunately, at best, a ~$7 game right now. I do however recommend this as an enjoyable game.  The value, however, isn't there just yet.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you're like me and you read game reviews before buying a game, you might be wondering why a lot of people are so massively frustrated at the lack of timely updates to this game. After playing the game, I can understand why. Secrets of Grindea is really, really good. Every single area in the game is polished to a diamond sheen. It's just a huge shame it isn't "finished".Pros+Great Animations and Soundtrack: I really am a fan of the animations here. While the character portraits are, in my opinion, a little offputting, the animations of the characters and enemies are top-quality and show action surprisingly well. The soundtrack is very well-made and fits the areas of the game well.+Fun Combat/Character Building: There's a lot of flexibility to the leveling system, and you don't have to fall into the Warrior/Mage/Rogue trope like many other games. The combat is fluid, and surprisingly challenging sometimes, even on normal mode.+Surprisingly funny satire: The narrative of Secrts of Grindea plays out like a satire of genres ranging from classic Legend of Zelda-likes to MMORPGs and Roguelikes. Unlike a lot of satire, however, it does this really well. Stick with the story, and don't pass it off as another edgy attempt at satire.Cons-Updates all over the place: From what I can see, development time is slow. You can access the beta, and the content in the beta is just as well-made as the rest of the game minus a few sound effects here and there. This, however, is not a lot of extra content, and the current beta maybe adds an hour-and-a-half to total gameplay time. I find it hard to be too critical of this considering the polish of the game, however.-Sometimes a bit too challenging: Some areas of the game can get hard. Like, really hard. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but due to some boss and enemy patterns, it can come down to rng more often than not. Skill will get you past it, but sometimes it can et annoying.Overall I would suggest waiting for the game to fully release, but if you're like me and don't care too much about early-access, I would recommend it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a very well thought out and carefully developed game. The developers are transparent with their project and unfortunately this isn't their full time job. If you're not the type who is:A) Interested in game design from a developer's point of view via blogsB) Interested in providing imput and feedback on a game in developmentC) Patient enough to wait as long as it may take for updates or full releaseThen Secrets of Grindea may not be for you, probably best to wait for the full release because you may be disappointed. Don't get me wrong, what's been already released is great. But you'll be left wanting more, like getting a three course meal and extra long for the entree. Development issues aside, Secrets of Grindea is a combination of several action adventure titles, made into a unique experience. There's a lot of heavy influence from Secret of the Mana, but there's some Legend of Zelda, and Monster Hunter thrown in too, but in a way that meshes well to create something fun and engaging within itself.  One of the best aspects is not having a class restriction. There's three skill trees: One Handed, Two-Handed, and Magic. You can focus on one, two, or a combination of three to create your own character, fully customed to your playstyle. Throw in the three passive trees: General, Melee, and Magic and you have ways to relly make skill combinations shine. So far the favorite build I've made is a Berserker that gets a magic attack bonus from less than 50% MP that randomly deals burn damage on attack and gets a physical attack bonus on burning enemies. (There are different types of support magic, but those are still in development) The story is engaging for what's there so far. Plenty of overused RPG tropes, but done in a humorous way that pokes fun of the genre or even some twists on what you would expect. A handful of pop culture references mixed in too for lampshading purposes. It's short, sweet, fun but still a work in progress. The real draw of the game is the Arcade Mode. Pretty much a Roguelike system where you run through randomly generated dungeons with whatever kind of build you want to try. This is probably where you'll be spending most of your time after "finishing" story mode. It feels like a roguelike, plays like a roguelike, and is as fun/infuriating as a rogulike. Good stuff, just make sure you go through story mode to avoid any spoilers. 6/10 for what's on the table now. Most likely would get a 9-10/10 when fully released. Buy if you're interested, definitely follow it if you're curious. Just keep in mind that it's only three people with full time jobs making this game. Updates are pretty slow when compared to standards you may be used to with other Early Acess titles. Not a bad thing, just a lot of care put into development.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Amazing.Graphically the natural areas feel genuine, there is good depth to all the environments (have a loot for the various NPCs building and repairing♥♥♥♥♥♥in town. Good attention to detail) and each enemy does appear to have a unique style. There are character portraits (which is awesome) and they are actually quite good with a variety of helpful emotions. All of the animations are 10/10; really satisfying to watch which really helps to promote the depth of their combat mechanics and enemy actions.The combat system is gold. There is a variety of incredibly rewarding abilities to choose from and the devs chose a fully open point buy system with the option of point buyback at a reasonably steep cost. IT'S SO GOOD. I feel liike my decisions matter, but also that i am free to try different abilities off the list to see if i like them without being locked in forever. There are also a surprising number of ways to coordinate different abilities together so you can get fairly creative with how you build your character. Overall good music choices; they reinforce the tongue-in-cheek comedy with which the game explores classic RPG tropes but nevertheless they in themselves well composed and very appropriately selected. No complaints regarding sound effects. As you might expect the story is rather weak...then again, it's only real weakness is being predictable. Since we're following even the tropic story arcs of this games predecessors, you might expect them to seem rather generic. Again I was surprised at the amount of depth that was given each plotline within the main questline. In fact even the side-quests have a truly authentic feel to them, though mostly this is due to the lively personality of the quest-givers.Man, the puzzles are just super, super good.Yeah just buy this game and play it with a friend. It's really good now, and they are still adding stuff.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								So my wife and I just finished the story to it's current state.The game is still missing a good bit of content, but we managed to get 10 solid hours of enjoyment out of it already. Pro:- Co op seems to work pretty well, sometimes desync here and there with summons or pets, but nothing major.- We enjoy the recipes and fish collecting. Finding new pets seemed neat at first until we realized they all start at the same stats, so changing pets just sets you backwards.- Love the hats and the masks, wish you could see the different shoes on your character. - Fun story :)- The open skill system with added effects at later levels.- Love the music, very nostalgic. - The card collecting adding stats was a GREAT way to make a seeminly simple mechanic actually worth using. Cons:- Some of the boss battles feel cheap, the hydra comes to mind as they will wait to attack the only time you have to attack the one that's on the ground, so you just end up running around in circles with your thumb up your rear. - Some boss fights have attack timings that rely more on lucky character placement as you can't react fast enough to block it or avoid it. They are still fun, but we def. ended up fighting Winter like 5 times :p. - - More recipes, more gear, more skills, just need more content. Overall, both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed what this game had to offer so far, and were glad to support the developers and look forward to future updates. P.S. Grand Master Ivy is a ♥♥♥♥♥.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Secrets of Grindea is what it says on the tin. A very grind happy ARPG in the vein of Secret of Mana, with cheesy humor and  all the tropes you tend to encounter in such games. Floating castles, Santa, haunted forests, and faeries all pop up, and there is a thread of story in there, though there is currently only 2 main dungeons in the game. I beat the available story mode with about 8 hours on the clock, inclusive of some grinding sessions. The main goal of grinding is hunting 'cards', which give permanent minor stat boosts. Overall, its fun enough solo, and I imagine it'd be a even better if I had played multiplayer. This game has great potential, and I hope the devs keep at it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								I love the older feel to this game; it reminds me of the many similar games I used to play growing up (Legend of Zelda, Chrono Trigger, Secret of Mana...). It also brings a lot more creation to you for your character, allowing you to customise your appearance and choose the way you level your abilities/skills (one of the main reasons I love RPGs). Not to mention that you can play with 3 other people, who make their own unique characters too. My brother and I bought this game yesterday and have had a blast playing it together, which was quite helpful as some of the boss fights would be a real pain by myself; farming for crafting materials too.Of coarse it is still in the beta and there are a few paths that are blocked off as the next map has literally not been added to the game yet, but my concern at this point, is worry for how big this game will be; My brother and I haven't played that long (though it has been a few hours) and it appears that we are about halfway through the story. You can have up to nine characters, but there isn't a whole lot you can do different between plays (you can make it more difficault and play alone for a real challenge or try a different build for your character) and I fear I may get board once I've finished the game once or twice, but thats just me; others might like shorter games.Having said that, I have no idea what the creators plan and what plot twist there could be, which could have this game spiralling much deeper and longer than it appears; my hope is for a game at least as long as the games I mentioned above. It is in beta after all, and so far I love this game.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								The people that created this game clearly understands what made some of the retro prgs great classics.This game manages not just to look like a cheap imitator with pixelated graphics to appeal to nostalgia, but rather it's a game with a very solid feel to it. Retro in likeness but refined to have better controls than most. Ill admit my nostalgia took me for quite a spin with SoG, reminding me a bit of some of the later made 2d zelda's as well as alttp as well as final fantasy.If you have played these types of games in the past then you know what you're getting yourself in for and I can highly reccomend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								This is a very well-made game, even though it's still in Early Access! I'm excited for every patch, and I love the passion put into this.I reccomend keyboard controls with it, but those get complicated after a while if you put in a LOT of spells, as is the same with using a controller.Overall, I highly reccomend this to play with some friends, especially in Story Mode! Arcade mode is just a simple, yet extremely difficult-as-it-goes kind of endless dungeon deal. You can upgrade your town(Called Arcadia) and get styles and items that can carry over to Story Mode!(My favorite has to be the Cat Ears and the Butterflies :D)The pixel art is amazing, the story is pretty funny, the characters are quite amazing, and overall it's great in my opinion! There's probably quite a few flaws, but I've yet to see any. Probably due to the rose-colored glasses I bear to these kind of games.Rating: 10/10!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								CAN NOT wait for this game to be finished!  The fact that you finally aren't hindered by class restrictions is amazing.  In the game I have two(three if I count the swarm) summons and can attack with a 2Handed beast of a weapon  at the same time!  An ACTUAL FACTUAL battle mage.  The dialogue is quirky!  With a name like Grindea not even the grinding gets boring!  Bosses can be challenging, but definitely doable!  Quests aplenty, lots of characters rather than just NPCs and such a huge list of mixable skills!  So far, so good!  Here's hoping it continues in that direction!Story isn't done due to Early Access, but there's plenty of fun to be had in Multiplayer and Arcade mode.  Both are limited to friends, but there are plenty of people on the Discussion board looking for others to play with!All in all, worth the price, but with all Early Access you just have to be patient!

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is not finished, so if you aren't into waiting for updates, it might not be for you.That being said, this game is ♥♥♥♥ing gold. The amount of hand-crafted detail in pretty much every aspect of the game is noticeable. If you watch the dev videos on the website you can watch the guy literally hand-craft every room. As that is a lengthy process, it is going to take some time between updates, but I am into this game for the long haul. Everything it does it does with pure excellence.If you really liked what you played so far and you have the 10 bucks to spend, I would recommend spending it on the DLC just to support the game. Being an indie developer is not easy, and these guys ♥♥♥♥ing deserve it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Great game, lots of replay value (beat it 5 times), the crafting system is on point, combat feels amazing, tons of spells to use, unique monsters, really cool bosses after the first one and an overall great expirience.Although this game excels in gameplay I don't feel very compelled by the story line, but that's probably because it's still in beta and hasn't had time to expand. So it will probably get better as the game grows.A couple things I don't like about the game is that it doesn't allow you to fight all bosses you've beaten before, it does with certain bosses that drop loot but not with others that don't, I hope this gets changed in the near future.Also a certain boss feels as if they aren't even a challange, the boss of which I'm talking about is Phaseman his attacks are fair and deal enough damage but he can't sustain enough damage to make it past he's second position, he simply dies too fast, I recommend that he's health pool should be increased dramatically. So many of he's center phase attacks I did not see until my 5th playthrough.Overall this game is pretty neato and I recomend you buy it. I currently have logged over 50 hours in offline mode on my laptop.

Early Access Review
								If you don't mind a grind like the title suggests, the gameplay is crisp and enjoyable, the crafting is fun, and the boss fights are challenging enough. The skillcap is high enough to feel that you can outplay most challenges. As I'm currently nearing the end of the available content (?) I think I can say that the game is already enjoyable and worth buying just to support the devs in finishing their excellent product. -Should you buy this? If you like Zelda, crafting, enjoy tight skill windows, etc, and don't mind a grindy game, then yes! -Should you not buy this? If you don't like a heavy grind. That's basically the only con in my book is it can be overly grindy at times. Strongly recommend!

Early Access Review
								**Edit** The game has been updated to now fix the save file deletion issue I had. As this was my only reason for saying "no - not in the current state" I have now changed it to a positive review (as it always was if fully read). Cheers!Great game, but not recomending it in its current state. Played for 4-5 hours with 2 others, my girlfriend was the host. Alt-tabbed to activate skype and both myself and the other guy we were playing with crashed and lost our characters. Not in the select screen.. simply gone. I would recommend supporting the game as we had a lot of fun whilst it lasted, with funny dialogue and a promising talent/combat system like a modernized zelda title. If you don't mind the potential loss of character in multiplayer, or you are a fan of hardcore rogue-like, feel free to play now :)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Nice one 9,5 of 10 points.Awesome combination of classic RPG titles with demanding fight system. Especially good that there nothing like healing potions, life regeneration or life steal. Meaning: The player needs to use the shield and evade enemy’s attacks probably in order to master the game… at least at the difficulty “hard” it is mandatory.For me, the complexity of the card- and the pet-system could be increased to give the player more flexibility to customize the character for the different kind of builds. Here some rough ideas for inspirations for the Story Mode:Card System:-	The Player is able to fight Cards more than one time. Cards are categorized in 3 different type of cards: Melee Atk, Magic Atk, Def-	The player needs to equip these cards in order to get the bonuses in a new interface-	The interface consists out of 5 columns with each 3 rows. In these columns the player can put the cards which he already has found. -	The combination of the cards in one column will result in some kind of a bonus. For Example if the player combines three “melee atk”-cards in one column, the benefits of the cards will be multiplied by the factor XX. This is only one example. The combination of 3 different types of cards should also bring an interesting bonus, for example: Increased Damage for a special Skill or something.Pet System:-	Different pets could have different kind of base stats. Depending on the characters build he will use different kind of pets. Or for example: For the pet “Gift” it takes less needed points to increase the “critical strike”-value (Luck) but instead more points to increase the life bonus.-	Pet Transformation:  Assumption: Pets can be caught more than once. On Level 10 you can combine to Pets by a percentage of XX. If the transformation succeeds the new transformed pet will be stronger than before. -	Equal to the Elite and non-elite enemies, pets can be caught as elite-version. This will be much harder (mini-game) but the base stats of the pet are higher than normal and the bonus by leveling up the pat is increased.That’s it for the rough ideas. I am sure you had some of these ideas already on your own. If some of the mechanism could be included in the game the complexity and therefore the playtime for each player will increase because especially the hardcore gamer will try to find out the best combination between builds, pets and cards I am looking forward to see and experience you upcoming work.Great job so far!Best RegardsInch

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Amazing GAME!For anyone who has ever fell in love with a SNES RPG like Secret of Mana , Secret of Evermore , Mario RPG , Final Fantasy , Chrono Trigger .. Prepare to fall in love with Secrets of Grindea.The Graphics are nostalgic and will make you feel like a kid again playing Super Nintendo.The Story is very good and the dialogue is fairly realistic , There are some sarcastic comments from the bag that actually made me laugh , many jokes about other rpgs and how silly some quests can be .Combat is fun , a nice pet leveling system , good amount of quests and gameplay .The bosses are tough like some dark souls/World of Warcraft Bosses . They all have their own gimics and are much more than just spank and tanks like many other games . The Hydra Boss is the best example that I have seen so far. Only thing that sucks is that to play co-op offline you have to go through alot of hoops and there is no online gamefinder. Hope they change that . GET THIS GAME!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								im just going to post a comment on how i think the game is and there is going to be some heavy feedback to the game creator.The game looks really nice i love the style they went with. the themes of the areas are weird since there is an halloween area and x-mass area so for me thats just outdated and kinda lazy to put in since its really easy to think of and really easy to make. The enemies are cool n all but they get a bit challenging if you dont grind alot to get lvles and rare drops. the dungeons are fun with puzzles and all. The bosses are fun to play but can be a bit frustrating if you get mad easy. there is not alot of replayability on the story since its the same quests over and over again. The arcade got more replayability but not so much since its really easy to die because you dont get alot of ways to heal yourself and the nurse is a damn ripoff, shes way to expensive to use but i guess that adds to the difficulty. the classes are extreamly unbalanced since 1-handed sword is the only good option if you want to do dmg, the mage needs alot of EP for the tiny amount of dmg the spells are doing since that are the only source of their dmg, they take alot of dmg because of their low armor and doesent do enough dmg for it to be worth putting your points in to. The 2-handed choice is a bit better but still underpowered since the 2-handed weapons only do 10 more dmg than the 1-handed and hits 3 times as slow tho they can hit twice as far as a 1-handed weapon wich is good for a small amount of enemies like a plant or smt. later into the game your sheild becomes to important and it breaks way to easy if you dont get a perfect block. The pets are kinda useless atm you need to fish ALOT if you want to get a tiny bonus from it, for me the pet is just in the way since sometimes i think its an enemy and just hit in the air xD. The items are cute and themebased i dont have anything against them tho the crafting system is pointless aswell in the current state of the game since you need to farm a good amount for the items when you can just get a better item in the next area.i think i got everything that i wanted, i got nothing against the game its really fun if you got friends to play with and the fact that you become a cute ghost when you die is an awsome addon. i recommend that you try the game if you have at least 1 friend to play with, i look forward to uppdates and buffs to the underpowered classes.This game at it current state get a 7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is one of the best games I've ever played. And it's not even finished. No wonder it's taken so long for the small (3 person) team to develop. Every inch of this game is beautifully designed and animated. The dialogue is fresh and interesting, and actually funny! The combat system is fun and allows for a surprisingly deep amount of customization and specialization particularly in coop play. The monsters are all unique and have well-designed AI and combat patterns. The story and the world is the best part. It's completely immersive, colorful, and filled with life. Very few games, even AAA open world titles, create a world that you want to explore as much as Grindea. A sense of adventure is in the air. One thing is clear. The developers have made this game with LOVE.To any old Maplestory players: buy this game and when you finish it you'll have TWO games that will physically pain you to remember because nothing will ever feel the same.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Basically it's one of those game which would have been a hit if released on the GBA  and NES consoles. I love how I can use different attacks as well as switch weapons as fast (though I would love if i could just toggle weapons with the same button,I play with a CONTROLLER,I haven't tried keyboard because I've known epic failure).Character customization is great and vanity items thankfully exist, not that i don't like the carrot sword but i'd rather have a wooden one. Surprisingly but still great and I love it, no classes like warrior, sage, mage, shaman,etc. just a free-lancer with all kinds of abilities, so make the most of it and become a unique class of your own. I'm not much of a 'craft' person but I have to admit it will take you far in the game, though I think we need more craft-able objects, I don't think you'll do ALL of them, but the material is fairly easy to procure given your 'grind'ing in the whole game. Side activities are plenty and good too( i still grinded more than doing them but they are definitely not boring, its a time to time thing).If you love the 90s versions of zelda and sword of mana. You will definitely like it. Although it's not completed yet Arcade mode is still something to die for literally in-game, something you can't miss, the story mode so far makes me feel like the updates are not enough, I went through the story but just couldn't get enough of it. I'll probably start from scratch and grind my way through the story again.I would definitely consider buying story-based dlc if ever put out in the market.Gameplay and features is all that matters to me and I got the best of both of it without the need or urge to have to m0d it like in more popular games,same genres (it's a compliment). I highly recommend it, don't download demo, buy the game, like I said, if you love zelda or sword of mana you won't regret it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Solid gold.Art style is adorable, sound effects are acceptable, combat is greatly varied if a little unbalanced in favor of melee over magic (I have no doubt this will change in time), story is on par so far with much more developed rpgs and the game feel is fantastic. Im going to buy these guys a coffee and frankly you should too.EDIT: After reaching 15 hours I think I can finally bring up some constructive criticism. (1) The minigame for taming pets should display the buttons we bound attack and block to instead of just showing a symbol for attack or block, this takes an extra second for the brain to process and the game moves so fast for the higher level pets that this can lead to failure within the first sequence. (I still havent managed to catch either the bee or the present.)(2) In arcade mode health should be returned automaticly upon lvl up and this effect should be reduced depending on how many people are in your game. IE: solo = 75% per lvl, 2 people 50% and so on. This would make arcade mode much more playable in singleplayer.(3) Would love to see more items added next update. My frontline char has over 25000 gold because there is nothing for her to buy anymore. I feel uneasy about saying this but I would gladly wait patiently for more story if it ment we got new items to buy/find/craft every second update or so.(4) My last and perhaps pettiest of gripes is that arcade mode is too damn hard. Ive spent half of these 20 hours in arcade mode and ive never made it past the 6th floor. Perhaps it was designed to be played in co op mode but seeing as none of my friends own this game and there are no dedicated servers for multiplayer Im kinda♥♥♥♥♥♥out of luck. Perhaps if my second gripe is implimented this would become much less of a problem but as it stands arcade mode is a bust for me. And thats about it. Still loving the game and want to see alot more of it!

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have to admit at first I had some doubts about this game- but they were instantly all put down.Secrets of Grindea is overwhelmingly well made and well thought out, and though there is still quite a bit of work to be done, the game in general has a bunch of stellar points that make me excited for further developments.The first thing I want to say is that it's obvious how dedicated the team is to the game right off the bat due to the artwork and the story. The pixel art for everything in general is just outstanding, detailed and gorgeous, and the level to which you can customize your character makes me beyond happy! I also love how you're put into a really cool story right away, with really strong characters, who each seem to have a clear definition of who they are, and most of the time a past as well. The game runs smoothly and has a bunch of cute monsters that roam freely outside of towns as well, and an easy system for fighting, equipping weapons and using different combos with quick slots.It's a challenging game, but not too frustrating- a VERY hard balance to create.Apart from features being unfinished (which was a given, since it's early access) and a few bugs that you're warned of (fullscreen issues with some processors), I have absolutley no complaints. Well worth the money, for sure!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Before you buy this game, there are large portions of the game not finished, if you intend to complete the game; wait on this.I completed my first run through on normal in about 4-6 hours. I'm not playing through on Hard, which by the way is really hard for those who enjoy a solid challenge mode.If you enjoyed games such as Secret of Mana, Legend of Zelda LTTP, and Diablo 2, this game might be for you. The combat works like the former games while the character builder works more like an action RPG. With a large variety of spells and melee abilities, part of the fun of this game is working on builds and seeing which ones work and which fail miserably.The shining point of this game is the combat and character building, so if you enjoy those things you might consider a purchase.The story is solid, the comical parts are funny, and you get just the right amount of information so that the cutscenes (which are all skippable) aren't too long, nor are you confused as to why you're doing something.The puzzles I've found hard rather difficult late in the game, practically one that requires you to build a bridge, with a limited amount of pieces, to cross the room. The crossing of the room is rather easy, figuring out how to get the extra item however is a real challenge that took quite a while to figure out.The boss designs are good too. With solid boss mechanics that are hard to the point where when you first face a boss you think “how is this possible?” But then is really satisfying once you complete it. Really this game has few flaws besides not being completed. Once it is done, it could easily be one of the best Action RPGs ever.

content:

Early Access Review
								I suck at reviews but yoloFriendly reminder for any and all Early Access Games: Before you purchase, observe the time it takes for them to dish out updates with some sort of new content. 100% completion is fairly easy due to the game... not being completed. If you dislike arcade mode, dislike speedrunning games for fun, and/or already have 100% completion, then this game will simply collect dust in your library until a new update comes out in which will probably equate to only an hour or so of fresh new content. Cheats are available if you desire due to the game still being "tested". The grinding aspect is there, but since it's an incomplete game, it truly doesn't take very long compared to if you've played a game like.. uh, Runescape and are experienced in the art of RNG drops.Take from this what you will and decide for yourself.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Classic style RPG filled with challenging puzzles and boss fights, an interesting combat system, and an addictive soundtrack. The co-op is amazing, and runs very smoothly with the new Steam connectivity patch, no more direct IP and port forwarding nonsense. The combat is clean, and challenging. You can't just hack and slash your way through dungeons. You have to think about your foes weaknesses and your strengths and play on that. The boss fights themselves can sometimes be considered a puzzle. Overall the storyline is fairly average(and at this moment incomplete), but the creators have put a lot of effort in making sure the dialogue is complete and and have even slipped in some comedy to give you a laugh every once in awhile.Good game overall with lots of potential, can’t wait to see what comes next!

								I've been playing for about 2 hours at this point, but wow I am impressed! This game reminds me of the SNES type action-RPG's that I loved growing up. While the game is still in development, I can't wait to see how it shapes up. For anyone who is thinking of buying this, it is important to note that there are two servers. The first is the stable server that you get access to with initial purchase. This is the one I started playing on before I realized there was another server: Frontline. Which is the beta server and has the latest updates and much more content.So far this game is exactly what I've been looking for in a "retro" style game. Currently 5/5. Will adjust score when game is released as a finished product.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Absolutely love this game. I wasn't sure, at first, if I would like it though. But once I started playing? I can't stop! I keep creating new characters so I can start fresh when I get my friends to start playing. Been telling people all about it! So ready for more to come out, but understand that it takes time. I'm just so impatient!!! Noticed a few minor glitches/issues, but completely understandable due to being in beta still. If you are joining someone else's game, you have to from the get-go (meaning: before they even start their game: thus at the invite screen when hosting a game). You can not jump in mid-game or there will be issues (screen freezing, health bar stretching across screen, screen resolution messed up, major lag, unable to charge powers, etc). Also, if you are joining a game and you are fighting monsters from/or in the Haunted Forest, you get X and Y (what look like coordinates) in your text/chat box. A little upset over the chances of getting a card, but that makes me play the game more TO get cards. Overall though, I HIGHLY recommend this game for others. It may be in beta, but with the amount of game play time and the story line/plot and just how much fun it is... it's totally worth it! Please! If you're even CONSIDERING buying this game, please do! It's worth it, I promise! Plus, the more people buy the beta, the better it helps the developers/builders of this game. GO PIXEL FERRETS!!!!

content:

Early Access Review
								This game is not finished, so if you aren't into waiting for updates, it might not be for you.That being said, this game is ♥♥♥♥ing gold. The amount of hand-crafted detail in pretty much every aspect of the game is noticeable. If you watch the dev videos on the website you can watch the guy literally hand-craft every room. As that is a lengthy process, it is going to take some time between updates, but I am into this game for the long haul. Everything it does it does with pure excellence.If you really liked what you played so far and you have the 10 bucks to spend, I would recommend spending it on the DLC just to support the game. Being an indie developer is not easy, and these guys ♥♥♥♥ing deserve it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								A meal in one long "taste test" session, but unlike Delver, it still appears to hold promise of completion.But I will review it as is, anyway.What can I say? It gives off a smell that reminds you of your younger days, mixed in with a smell that promises freedom.When you take a bite, it's not bad at all. Although its name is related to the exercise of "Grinding" in most RPGs and it makes references to it, you'll be grinding the night away, with it's systems designed to make grinding less of a chore.You can also choose to challenge yourself in the "Hard" mode. This mode will make you suffer, but you will also feel much more rewarded afterwards, the taste of victory oh so sweeter.There's also an arcade mode, a delve into a more "arcade-y" meal. You've only got one life and you have to make it as far as possible. It also gives rewards to the main story, if you want an excuse to taste this mode.

Early Access Review
								This is a very well-made game, even though it's still in Early Access! I'm excited for every patch, and I love the passion put into this.I reccomend keyboard controls with it, but those get complicated after a while if you put in a LOT of spells, as is the same with using a controller.Overall, I highly reccomend this to play with some friends, especially in Story Mode! Arcade mode is just a simple, yet extremely difficult-as-it-goes kind of endless dungeon deal. You can upgrade your town(Called Arcadia) and get styles and items that can carry over to Story Mode!(My favorite has to be the Cat Ears and the Butterflies :D)The pixel art is amazing, the story is pretty funny, the characters are quite amazing, and overall it's great in my opinion! There's probably quite a few flaws, but I've yet to see any. Probably due to the rose-colored glasses I bear to these kind of games.Rating: 10/10!

If you are a person who likes to collect things, try to find interesting exploits and glitches, then the game is perfect for you if you put it on frontline. If you are a hardcore speed runner, the game is still good for you even if it isnt on frontline as the arcade mode has infinate replay value and you could try and give yourself a challenge by putting the story mode on hardmode. However if you are a person that gets disinterested in things very quickly, this game is fun but not the best for you. UpdatesIf you put the game on frontline you will get very frequent game changes, update ideas, bug fixes, and other things that will have you able to play the game over and over to see what they changes and how it affects the game. For regular/non-frontline updates, you will see updates every so often, sometimes quicker than you think, but not as frequent as frontliners.Max levelThere isnt a max level and i would know becuase most are levels 30-40 while im level 35000 something. content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
Early Access Review
A blend of scott pilgrim and Diablo 2Note: This entire review is from playing story mode by myself. I haven't tried multiplayer and arcade mode I've only tried a small amount, so realize this isn't the most complete review.Pros:The game has an action rpg feel with it's talent trees and skills that is like diablo 2/torch light. There's alot of depth here for you to customize your hero into a full warrior or a mage or a hybrid of the two. The retro look makes it seem easier to pick upAs you go deeper into the game the boss fights become more challenging, to the point where I can almost guarantee that you'll die by the 4th or 5th bossThere's a crafting system that reminds me of dragonquest XIII, it's pretty dope. You take misc. items and you combine them to form stronger swords, shields, etc.Cons:The story seems like a parody of other games, many bosses are references to old games and anime like a gundam boss and things similar. And the title of the game itself, Secrets of "Grindea", is a reference to grinding, or hours of constantly doing monotonous tasks in mmorpgs in order to get something. Many of the cities like EverGrind are references like this too. You can definitely see where the creators drew inspiration and they take alot of time to give nod to that but I also wish that they'd take their own story and lore a bit more serious. Admittedly I haven't really taken the time to read much of the chat boxes but that's the impression I get from some of the bosses and atmosphere. Some of the spells feel lackluster at first and I find myself constantly respeccing my hero.Would I recommend it?I would to someone who's already a fan of a scott pilgrim beat em up or like diablo 2/torchlight type of action rpg or someone who's into games like the older zelda games like link to the past. For $6-$10 I think this game is well worth the price. There are promised updates with more dungeons in the future which I'm really looking forward to. I'm only level 13-14 at the time of this review and not even close to finishing all of the content, there's definitely enough content and grinding to keep a player in the game until updates arrive.

Early Access Review
								Great little RPG that can give you quite a bit of fun and a lot of hours of gameplay. The combat is very good, fluid and doesn't make you "get caught in animation" with that said, you can miss attacks if not facing the same way as the enemy. This can make things a bit difficult in tight spots, however the blocking system works really well.All in all this game is great, you wont regret buying it, full price or on sale (which I have yet to see it do) however I have one caution for any buyer....****DO NOT BUY THIS ON STEAM!********You're missing out on a free DRM free copy!! Thats right, if you buy this here you don't have access to the DRM free copy, but if you buy it through either Secrets of Grindea's website, or on Humble Bundle's site they give you access to both the Steam key and a DRM free copy! So DO NOT BUY HERE! Or you're forced to miss out on that free copy. Hope you find as much fun in this little title as I have.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								         Well, I picked this up thinking, I have some time off and don't want to get too involved in anything and this seems like it could fit the niche.  I'm not positive how far into the game I currently am but it's been about 5 hours of entertainment ( i've actually been more entertained in the past 5 hours than almost my entire play through of Fallout 4).           The "STORY" my gaming jesus  so far the little tid bits of what i'll call lore for now, are spaced well and very attractive to anyone who likes story heavy games.  The way the story is being told and the humor is very satisfying.  Giving you enough slack to enjoy bashing in enemies faces while at the same time being 100% ready to get right back into whichever quest you were up to when you decided to stop and "grindea" few levels out ;D .         The "ART STYLE" is fairly simple and "old school" classic indie.  I can't complain though considering it allows all varieties of computers to play it aswell as not degrading the quality of the gameplay itself.  They also do a decent job at making the variants of objects reasonably refreshing in their surroundings.         The "COMBAT MECHANICS" aren't overwhelming, timing is key, patterns exist in most cases (which typically require a decent amount of focus to manipulate). Although the spell casting can be very frustrating with keybind locations.  Personally I would avoid a heavy attack magic play (unless they format it to work more effectivly in the final game).  Overall it feels pretty fluid.         The "CHARACTERS" some of them are steriotypical but they fill the rolls they hold very well and give most players a comfortable feeling from the homefront foward.  Some of them (so far) have had decent story driven developement and I look foward to finishing the game to see their full fruiting when I can finish this game.        "OVERALL" So far i'll give this game a solid 7.6/10 (For it's genre and from a single player only unfinished playthrough experience).  It is, however, still in Beta.  Meaning the More people who try this game (and hopefully enjoy it) will give it the opprotunity to finish developement at a reasonable pace and fund the developers.*SUBNOTES-I don't usually bother writing reviews since they can be a dime a dozen with most overly hyped games or just mass playerbase games that I commonly find myself playing to pass time.  I apologize if my format isn't visually pleasing, if I made any spelling/grammar mistakes, or if it wasn't in depth enough to make you atleast want to try the game (though you seriously should atleast look into trying it c: ).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Before you buy this game, there are large portions of the game not finished, if you intend to complete the game; wait on this.I completed my first run through on normal in about 4-6 hours. I'm not playing through on Hard, which by the way is really hard for those who enjoy a solid challenge mode.If you enjoyed games such as Secret of Mana, Legend of Zelda LTTP, and Diablo 2, this game might be for you. The combat works like the former games while the character builder works more like an action RPG. With a large variety of spells and melee abilities, part of the fun of this game is working on builds and seeing which ones work and which fail miserably.The shining point of this game is the combat and character building, so if you enjoy those things you might consider a purchase.The story is solid, the comical parts are funny, and you get just the right amount of information so that the cutscenes (which are all skippable) aren't too long, nor are you confused as to why you're doing something.The puzzles I've found hard rather difficult late in the game, practically one that requires you to build a bridge, with a limited amount of pieces, to cross the room. The crossing of the room is rather easy, figuring out how to get the extra item however is a real challenge that took quite a while to figure out.The boss designs are good too. With solid boss mechanics that are hard to the point where when you first face a boss you think “how is this possible?” But then is really satisfying once you complete it. Really this game has few flaws besides not being completed. Once it is done, it could easily be one of the best Action RPGs ever.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Secrets of Grindea is an RPG with real time combat like Zelda,and is fun to play with or without a friend,which is really rare on RPG with MP games.Pros:*No class restrictions (you can be a fire mage with a cloud and a ice friend protecting you,i'm serious)*Puzzles,LOADS of puzzles,and you will need some time to think about some.*Character creation,not much to talk about here,move along.*Regions. They can vary from a city to a spoopy forest,and they are all fun!*Combat,mixing skills,making awesome combos,and crafting another weapon to be stronger,REPEAT!*Pixel art is great!*The Story. The characters are lovable,and with time you will change your opinion about some,also,there's some plot twists here,funny jokes there,and TONS of sarcasm.*Cards,or Monster Cards if you like,are rare drops from enemies,if you got a card from a enemy,it will give you a random bonus and a cute artwork from the enemy you killed,which is ALWAYS a plus in my book.*Soundtrack is good*Balanced (at least on normal mode),like the Yetis are MADE to tank your attacks,and some other enemies are made to be annoying.*Easy to connect to MP through Steam and AWSOME controller support.*THE EASTER EGGS!!!!!! I managed to find a Triforce near the pile of gold in the flashback sequence!!!! :D*You can replay bosses to get more loot from them,well,everyone but...Cons:*You can't replay Winter's or the Mt. Bloom boss fights,I mean,the Winter boss was one of the most fun boss battles I ever saw,even if it didn't drop ANY loot,I would be playing it for ages,not for the Mt. Bloom boss fights,but they could have some extra loot and the replay feature anyway :|*GRINDING,and i'm not a fan of it.It's not just walking in circles to begin a battle,you have to kill ALL enemies in the room to spawn another wave of enemies,although this sistem is great,it's boring to get the action going.*The crafting system could be improved,like seeing the item kinda faded away,because my friend thought the ''red emmiter matrix'' was a calendar,that's right A CALENDAR. And there's not enough recipies...*Not even at level 10 (max level of skills) my Frosty Friend could kill a Rabby in 1 hit,and a Rabby is the second enemy in the game,and it has ≅ 120 HP.*The cards are just TOO rare to make it fun to grind,and it's based around luck too,so just to get a Jumpkin card,I had to stop my playthrough over how boring it was to get a 0,5% of card drop,to try again the other day :|*The ''character portraits'' (the picture that appears when you talk to a character) are bad,they aren't pixelated,witch isn't that bad for itself,but they look more like a photo that has been glued there,the quality is horrible too.Final Veredict:9/10It's a really fun game to play alone or with friends,if you like an ARPG I would recommend buying it.It also has a Talking Bag...Did I say there was a Talking Bag yet??

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Absolutely love this game. I wasn't sure, at first, if I would like it though. But once I started playing? I can't stop! I keep creating new characters so I can start fresh when I get my friends to start playing. Been telling people all about it! So ready for more to come out, but understand that it takes time. I'm just so impatient!!! Noticed a few minor glitches/issues, but completely understandable due to being in beta still. If you are joining someone else's game, you have to from the get-go (meaning: before they even start their game: thus at the invite screen when hosting a game). You can not jump in mid-game or there will be issues (screen freezing, health bar stretching across screen, screen resolution messed up, major lag, unable to charge powers, etc). Also, if you are joining a game and you are fighting monsters from/or in the Haunted Forest, you get X and Y (what look like coordinates) in your text/chat box. A little upset over the chances of getting a card, but that makes me play the game more TO get cards. Overall though, I HIGHLY recommend this game for others. It may be in beta, but with the amount of game play time and the story line/plot and just how much fun it is... it's totally worth it! Please! If you're even CONSIDERING buying this game, please do! It's worth it, I promise! Plus, the more people buy the beta, the better it helps the developers/builders of this game. GO PIXEL FERRETS!!!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								After 20+ hours i can confidently say this game has me hooked. So far only played single player and am really enjoying it. The story and characters are rather cute and funny which is a nice change of pace from new age games and quite reminiscent of an old school RPG atmsophere. The puzzles are also well done. There was a few moments in the in the Fae forest that were top notch and had me thinking the whole time going in between back and forth desperately trying to figure out what to do. The combat is also very enjoyable. Very rarely can you just "go ham" and often you have to think before attacking. Boss fights actually being a challenge and needing strategy is a huge deal to me. AS for a score not sure what i grade it its good but i dont know if its that good. If this game gets some more content a littel more balancing and some final polish 10/10 easy. As is, I have to rate it a 7/10 due to lack of content and a few balancing issues, If they fill out that support tree make that a 8/10 (biased mage player here XD). Support is a staple to co-op play in any game so it will be nice to see what they will add. I must say i dont know how a healer or heal skills would be implemented but it would be nice for someone to be able to play "Team Mom" keeping everyone healthy and buffed. Maybe a regen over time heal or something. So my final call if u dont mind spendning the money and it looks decent to you then by all means go ahead. Its fun, but short, yet retains a very unique style you won't find elsewhere. As someone playing the game atm my final call is please go buy and help them finsh the game. It is truly a masterpiece just in need of some more content. If you really enjoy the game remember theres a hat dlc you can buy to help support the devs as well.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is very promising. It may be early access but don't let that deter you as it has tons of content to keep you interested. If you're a fan of games like Final Fantasy, the Legend of Zelda, Fantasy Life or other similar RPG games you'll find joy here. The 4th Wall is something it likes to smash down quite often as you'll come across many Easter Eggs and reference, one being the Triforce laying on the ground or a character mentioning "/" commands. Secrets of Grindea knows it's a video game and uses that to it's pleasure since it allows it to make tons of jokes. Heck you start out from a town called "Startington". The characters are also quite pleasing to meet. Your father has a backstory and a driving motive that I find interesting to explore, as you plung further into the game his past is opened up to a point where you realize you aren't the only character of importance running around Grindea. The games controls seemed odd to me at first but I later came to admire how well they work. The arrow keys act as your movement while Z & X are your sword and shield. You have items and skills linked to the A,S,D,F,G,Q,W,E,R,T keys which can each be rebinded. I tried to change them around but I find it much more comfortable to use the defaults. I definitely recommend this game to any fans of RPGs and in-game collecting.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Classic style RPG filled with challenging puzzles and boss fights, an interesting combat system, and an addictive soundtrack. The co-op is amazing, and runs very smoothly with the new Steam connectivity patch, no more direct IP and port forwarding nonsense. The combat is clean, and challenging. You can't just hack and slash your way through dungeons. You have to think about your foes weaknesses and your strengths and play on that. The boss fights themselves can sometimes be considered a puzzle. Overall the storyline is fairly average(and at this moment incomplete), but the creators have put a lot of effort in making sure the dialogue is complete and and have even slipped in some comedy to give you a laugh every once in awhile.Good game overall with lots of potential, can’t wait to see what comes next!

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								If you don't mind a grind like the title suggests, the gameplay is crisp and enjoyable, the crafting is fun, and the boss fights are challenging enough. The skillcap is high enough to feel that you can outplay most challenges. As I'm currently nearing the end of the available content (?) I think I can say that the game is already enjoyable and worth buying just to support the devs in finishing their excellent product. -Should you buy this? If you like Zelda, crafting, enjoy tight skill windows, etc, and don't mind a grindy game, then yes! -Should you not buy this? If you don't like a heavy grind. That's basically the only con in my book is it can be overly grindy at times. Strongly recommend!

content:

								Your luck couldn't be any worse.You've been in the same area for hours already.The ground is lined with corpses.The grass runs red with fallen blood. The enemy's, yours, it doesn't matter.No Rabby, no Green Slime, no Mrs. Bee could ever hope to stop you, yet they still file in for the slaughter.And the only thing going through that borderline-psychopathic mind of yours is, "Where the f*** is that card?!"Grinding's the name of the game, bucko. The story's pretty good, albeit pretty short, allowing you to grind for more XP and cards and whatnot. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a really good time-killer, a much better Castle Crashers, or a replacement for that steaming pile of sh*t that is Spiral Knights.Also, Winter is no longer my favorite season. 10/10

Product received for free
Early Access Review
								This is a very well-made game, even though it's still in Early Access! I'm excited for every patch, and I love the passion put into this.I reccomend keyboard controls with it, but those get complicated after a while if you put in a LOT of spells, as is the same with using a controller.Overall, I highly reccomend this to play with some friends, especially in Story Mode! Arcade mode is just a simple, yet extremely difficult-as-it-goes kind of endless dungeon deal. You can upgrade your town(Called Arcadia) and get styles and items that can carry over to Story Mode!(My favorite has to be the Cat Ears and the Butterflies :D)The pixel art is amazing, the story is pretty funny, the characters are quite amazing, and overall it's great in my opinion! There's probably quite a few flaws, but I've yet to see any. Probably due to the rose-colored glasses I bear to these kind of games.Rating: 10/10!

								I suck at reviews but yoloFriendly reminder for any and all Early Access Games: Before you purchase, observe the time it takes for them to dish out updates with some sort of new content. 100% completion is fairly easy due to the game... not being completed. If you dislike arcade mode, dislike speedrunning games for fun, and/or already have 100% completion, then this game will simply collect dust in your library until a new update comes out in which will probably equate to only an hour or so of fresh new content. Cheats are available if you desire due to the game still being "tested". The grinding aspect is there, but since it's an incomplete game, it truly doesn't take very long compared to if you've played a game like.. uh, Runescape and are experienced in the art of RNG drops.Take from this what you will and decide for yourself.

								This game is very good. Has everything an RPG needs - slimes, swords and a broken keyboard due to rage. The storyline is really interesting and kept me hooked.There are some things that could be changed/added:1. Movement: we need to attack diagonally. I know this game is supposed to be old school, but firing projectiles is annoying.2. More weapons and armour3. Better bonuses for when you max out a skill or talent4. More hairstyles (I wanted something spiky but not too spiky) and beards5. Health regenWhat I liked:- This game in general- Lightsabres- Killing Winter and the three Hydras after so many attemptsWhat I didn't:- The game was too short (I know it's in EA so I won't count that)- Item drop rates were hella low (took me ages to get Cystals for my lightsabre)I can't wait to play this game when it's fully released.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Holy what in the hell....yeah, this game is full of charm, the Grinding in Grindea isnt actually that bad, and grinding for tons of collectibles is fun! the battle is tight, with a few minor things and the graphics, the design, heck, even the missions that have depth to it, all of these components are really awesome and this game,. even in early access, is starting to already shape up as one of the better rpg games that ive played this year.TL;DR: This game is AWESOME! you like nostalgic zelda-like exploration games, but with more customization, collecting and crafting, really fun skill progression, abilities that vary greatly, and enemies that are designed smartly and with a challenge???  Then buy this game!Graphics: alright, its a top down 32 bit looking game. and man, do they do a wonderful job at making sure every pixel counts, and every animation is fluid! The graphics are nostalgic, and they are done wellSound: Man, the music is really suited for an adventure game. i really was not diaaposinted by the music at all, very well done. the sound effects were plenty, and they had depth and actual weight and distinction to each move you make. Of course, its nothing too fancy, but its not done poorly, they made every sword swing, every fireball, and every crate breaking sound goodGameplay: Man, I am very impressed with the combat. its quick, its fluid, the enemies variety are very challenging and require to think about how to approach each one, ESPECIALLY WHEN THEY START WORKING TOGETHER AND F*** YOU UP!! oh man, there were some parts where i was sincerely triggered cause i couldn't get past some enemies when i really wanted to blow through a part of the stage to complete my mission. I played this on the hard difficulty, so im sure that why they were much more difficult to kill. Anyways, what everyone will definitley enjoy about how the combat is done is by the way you character is...Customization: Yes, this game is very customization friendly! You want to go nothing but tank? well choose the corresponding stats to boost you defense significantly, dump your points into two handing that tree bracnh you get when you first start out, and sponge away the many slimes presented, all the way until youre three hours deep into the pumpkin forest, trying to hack away at ghosts that keep friggin disappearing in front of your face, and even though you know thats not the way to kill them, youre already soo hellbent on getting the last hack on his ectoplasmic butt, because your a tank, with the brain of the sponge, and YOU DONT KNOW ANYTHING ELSE!!!..... But, if you do have a moment of awreness, you could totally respec you're guy on the fly! you can totally dump those pointe that went into tanking into something like a snow buddy. A cute little snowball dude who's totally loyal to the cause. And hey, why stop theree? You can throw your invstment into four different magic categories, earth, fire, ice,. and wind! And best belieive that your armor, and your clothes are customizable too! I REALLY appreciate the developers for going this route, AWESOME!Look, im gonna stop here and give you fair warning. As of this review, there are somethings that are still locked in the skill tree, because they are still indevelopment. Which leads me to one of the biggest troubles of this game. THERE IS LITERALLY NO HEALING. the only way to heal, is to pick up healt orbs from enemies (which drop pretty frequently), go back to town, or lvl up. Nopne of this was really an issue......until you start fighting bosses. OHHHHHHH man, this is the biggest flaw of this game.HOW THE HELL DO I BEAT THE DAMN BOSSES THAT ARE OP, WITH NOT A SINGLE HEALING POTION OR SKILL!!!!This, my dear developer, is THE MOST infuriating thing in the game, I pray to the flying spaghetti monster that you include something, cause this has got me beyond vexed. And the only other thing i gotta complain is the way blckin is handled, it seems real unforgiving, and even a bit unresposive at times. But hopefully, these things will be fixed.

								I purchased Secrets of Grindea for myself and 3 other friends and I'm in love. Lists are easy and fun to read, so here we go:-Pros--The storyline and dialogue are amazing. Very few games give me the sense of adventure and laughs that Grindea has-Art and music directory is great, with a vast, diverse world to explore-Multiplayer is incredibly fun. If early Legend of Zelda had multiplayer, it would come really close to this-The items and characters are rich and addicting, making you explore and grow-Cons--Multiplayer took some toying around to get to work, but was manageable-The controls feel foreign to start, which can be discouragingOverall, Secrets of Grindea stands solid on its own, but with friends, it knocks the genre out of the park.

								Legend of Zelda a link to the past + many other old school games with a pretty good amount of comedy involved. I mean really it doesn't get much better than that. There's still work being done from time to time, but in my opinion this is a fun and challenging game, the more people, the tougher the enemies become. I don't have a lot of hours invested yet, but that's mostly due to personal things that just get in the way of game time. But for the short amount of hours I have put in, I can say the moment my friends and I are available to jump back in, we plan to do so. 								It's been about 2 years since I purchased the game and they've added about 20 minutes of play time to the campaign, which I honestly thought would have been done by now, seeing ONE patch being put out every 3-5 months is NOT very encouraging either, let me stop here and say this game has potential and can be fun, however it simply is NOT worth paying 15 dollars for, period. So to that point, its been 6 years + in development and they are like maybe 35% done with the campain not to mention any other features or balancing. It just tiring to check back every 6-8 Months and to typically only see 1 patch posted. TL;DR: The game will most likely never be finished, over 6 years of dev and less than half done. Fun for a few hours or more so, if its on sale for less than 10 bucks its worth it otherwise hard pass this one.

Love the pet system too. I would recommend this game for people who have some freidns who are looking for a new game to play because this is the jackpot.

								The game is great so far its very challanging and soo much to do. I just hope to see great variety of skills so everyone can make their own unique fighter . Like every game i see I always look for daggers and dual wielding aspect of the game.  I'm the type of person who like to see great weapon variations along with skills with each specific weapon skills and animation. Would like to see things as a heavy weapons such as axe and claymore along with spears with each its own animation style and short handed weapons like claws daggers swords. The magic is great as is each with a skill for each element I would say be nice to have dark and light but light i can figure would be a problem since light usually represent heals and that alot would make people over powered and take the fun out the game. I enjoy the stat system that focuses on your style of gameplay such as i sacrificed most of my heavy def gear for gears that give me speed boost and decent crit rate. These are all just my opinion and I'm pretty sure its been crazy suggestions. I wanted to add my own input that would have you enjoy different styles of gameplay and still maintain a challenge to its styles. The dungeons is just like old school dungeon runners with real hardcore puzzle and the noble tempting chest that seem impossible to obtain but with enough work and shift in other puzzle u can maintain it with a great reward. The enemies are very challenging which I love lmao no one like a game way to easy thats unfulfilling nor does people enjoy games that are psychotically hard but this is right between I hope to face more challenging enemies in the near future. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is very promising. It may be early access but don't let that deter you as it has tons of content to keep you interested. If you're a fan of games like Final Fantasy, the Legend of Zelda, Fantasy Life or other similar RPG games you'll find joy here. The 4th Wall is something it likes to smash down quite often as you'll come across many Easter Eggs and reference, one being the Triforce laying on the ground or a character mentioning "/" commands. Secrets of Grindea knows it's a video game and uses that to it's pleasure since it allows it to make tons of jokes. Heck you start out from a town called "Startington". The characters are also quite pleasing to meet. Your father has a backstory and a driving motive that I find interesting to explore, as you plung further into the game his past is opened up to a point where you realize you aren't the only character of importance running around Grindea. The games controls seemed odd to me at first but I later came to admire how well they work. The arrow keys act as your movement while Z & X are your sword and shield. You have items and skills linked to the A,S,D,F,G,Q,W,E,R,T keys which can each be rebinded. I tried to change them around but I find it much more comfortable to use the defaults. I definitely recommend this game to any fans of RPGs and in-game collecting.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 6
Early Access Review
								Having not grown up with this sort of game, i did not feel any nostalgia while playing it. However, that didnt stop me from really enjoying it. Its still in beta, but the story still gave me about 10 hours of gameplay, and it also has an arcade mode which is based on the fighting parts of the story. As of writing this review, i have spent 2 hours in the arcade mode, and I doubt i will be stopping there.Dont let the fact that it's still in beta stop you from at least thinking about this game, as its already really good. Parts of the world map aren't free for players to explore as of now, and im sure they will take very long to make as the game looks astoundingly beautiful, but what there is currently is great. The main quest is also still not finished, it just abruptly stopped, though there is still alot of it. As i said, the game gave me 10 hours of gameplay, which i find is a very suitable amount of time for a game.The story consists of puzzles, bullet hell styled boss fights, combat, side quests and obiously the story itself. Some of the puzzles were actually quite hard, to the point where i had to look up gameplay videos find out the solution, while others were a decent head scratcher that wouldn't last too long, or too short. The boss fights all take a couple tries to beat, but never enrage you like other games (namely shovel knight). I recommend this game to everyone, though especially to people who like The legend of Zelda, and other RPGs like it.
